body.name: The Stone Secret: A Thriller Novel
body.description: He spent twenty years in prison.She spent twenty years living a lie.At 2:00 a.m. Sylvia Stone awakens to a letter on her doorstep suggesting the handsome carpenter who was convicted of murdering her mother twenty years earlier is innocent. The anonymous letters continue, each one revealing details only the true killer would know, making Sylvia question her testimony so many years ago.Newly released from prison, Rhett Cohen has spent the last two decades with only one thing on his mind: Find the man who framed him for killing Marjorie Stone, and kill him. Rhett will do anything to get his revenge, including manipulating the late woman’s daughter.But suddenly, Sylvia disappears.Public interest in the twenty-year-old case reignites around Sylvia’s disappearance. The suspect? The man she accused of murder—the reticent former inmate, Rhett Cohen.Under mounting pressure from the police and media, Rhett must find Sylvia, convince the angry small-town mob that he is innocent, and prove he was framed—or risk going back to prison for life.In this twisted tale of revenge and deception, there are two sides to every story, and two faces with every crime.* For fans of Gillian Flynn, Jeneva Rose, Karin Slaughter, Lisa Jewell, and Frieda McFadden. *What readers are saying:“action packed… a clever psychological thriller.” ★★★★★ @honeybee.reads“chilling… literally stayed up till midnight to finish it.” ★★★★★ @le.kindle_booklife“sharp twists, turns, and surprises from beginning to end.” ★★★★★ Cathy, Goodreads“This book puts the thrill in thriller.” ★★★★★ Gina, Goodreads“O.M.G. I did not expect that ending. What a ride.” ★★★★★ CW Goodreads“Unpredictable… could not put it down.” ★★★★★ Paige, Goodreads“An awesome read.” ★★★★★ Heidi, Goodreads“Completely unexpected. The twists and turns, lies, and evidence have you headed in one direction. Before you realize what happened, it all turns around and shocks you!” ★★★★★ Deb, Goodreads“Kept me guessing til the last page.” ★★★★★ Kdrbck, Goodreads Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Stone Secret
reviews.reviewText: Boy oh boy!! This book is extremely interesting and engaging! I absolutely fell in love with at the very beginning! The story is about a young lady that has made a difference in her home town! She still has bad days, especially after having a bad night! However, the good days outnumber the bad! She and her little dog are good about seeing to others needs. Except the ending is definitely different!! I'm not saying anything else so as not spoil anything!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Wow! I’m not sure how I feel after reading this book
reviews.reviewText: Ms McKinney does not fail to write original work. Delving into the human psyche and pulling out the inner workings of the mind is something she does with mystery and flair. A crazed woman who is manipulating others and the legal system is at the center of this complicated process. As the story unfolds and her fears are revealed, we begin to see what her fantasies have done to the unfortunate people who have crossed paths with her. But eventually her actions become her reality and she is forced to confront her part in this well thought out plan. Interesting and intriguing. Enjoy…

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A real thriller
reviews.reviewText: The two Amanda writer really put together a fantastic tale. It starts like a usual crime story but it developers so many twists and turns that readers will find that they can not put this book down. The ending is a real shocker. There is no gore but lots of suggestions about what happened. It is a story that shows truth will prevail eventually. This book is worth your time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good story but terrible writing
reviews.reviewText: Rounded up from 2.5. I enjoyed the ride this book took me on, but the writing was so bad I suspected maybe a rough draft was published.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Bullies, deviants, and criminals ruin what could be a peaceful world. In this book it's hard to tell who will come out on top. It was a good plot and kept this reader's interest until the end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Interesting, different and not what I'd call a thriller
reviews.reviewText: A new take on a mystery. Not what I'd call a thriller. Keeps you interested and has intriguing details. It doesn't go where you expect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A well twisted tale!
reviews.reviewText: It was a captivating story and it kept me in suspense as I wondered who the villain was. It was her mother's writing that made me suspicious as to the stability of Sylvia. But what a great ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It kept my attention and when I paused in reading, I wanted to get back to it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A mother killed. Her killer due out of prison and adamant that he didnt do it. Daughter and killer join up to solve the mystery of who did do it. With a few twists and turns on the way. Really enjoyed this book and couldn't put it down.
I really enjoyed the first part of the book, but the book seemed to deteriorate as I continued to read. Hence the 3 stars.
First time author for me and what a story. Well worth reading...just know that once you start you won't want to stop reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A tragic life for Rhet and Sylvia in different ways. The course of events in his release seem somewhat coincidental

Not my usual genre but I thought the blurb was intriguing. i have to say as I read it I was compelled to keep reading, so it certainly fit into ‘couldn’t put it down’. Looking back clue crumbs were left and a couple of holes unravelled.No spoilers. Not a bad read.
